features.title: the heart desired:
list: A service for effective dictionary memorization.
The ability to use the keyboard.
No necessity to be distracted and fumble around the screen in search of buttons.
The ability to quickly view additional information about a word, ideally with usage examples.
Voice acting with the ability to choose the speed of speech.
A dictionary shared with the translation service.
text: Hotkeys on the basic buttons: {ESC} and {Enter}. When typing from blocks: a block can either be clicked or dragged, or selected by the first letter from the keyboard. You can remove the chosen block by pressing {BackSpace}.
When studying words, phrases or sentences of not excessive length, the buttons remain in owners place.
Possible to view a dictionary article from Yandex.Dictionaries.

Voice acting works with the standard browser-based Web Speech API, which is supported by most modern browsers. When the browser allows, in the article mode or after a successful workout, a button with voiceover appears in the title. Texts are also spoken automatically, which can be turned off in the settings. Voice acting can be stopped by double-clicking on the page.
A lot of settings with filters by language, text length, number of words in the training cycle, etc.
Several levels of complexity for training.

I usually use Yandex or Google Translator. Both of them make it possible to save a word or phrase. However, none of them makes it possible for either user-friendly memorization of translations or the use of the dictionary by other services. Google Translate only allows you to upload Saved translations to CSV. 
This or your other dictionaries in CSV and JSON format can be uploaded to {uploadLink}.

User data (settings, progress, uploaded dictionaries) is stored locally in the browser (IndexedDB). 
User dictionaries are also parsed locally (by File API).

comics.1: When I had subscribed to an online service for learning foreign languages, with a well organized interface, where everything is at hand and with hotkeys!
comics.2: When a month later they rolled out a new interface... Without hotkeys and with buttons jumping across the screen from page to page!
comics.3: When a few months later they broke the work with dictionaries...
comics.4: When I had got a response from the support: fixing dictionaries is not included in the current priorities.
comics.5: Fixing dictionaries is not included in the priorities of the foreign language learning service!!! ü§Øü§¨
comics.6: I'm a web developer! I'll write my own thing for memorizing a dictionary with hotkeys and catties!

addDictionary.title: Uploading the user's dictionary

csvFormat.text:
This format is fit for imported "Saved" from {Google}. To do this, after exporting to Google Sheets, select {path}. 
The match of the csv file columns and fields is set after parsing in a following form. If the first line of the file contains column headers, select a special checkbox in the form.

jsonFormat.text: Json files in the following format are fit for parsing: {list}
list: "Favorites" from {yandex} (if you can get your hands üë©üèª üîß on it),

contains an array of objects with required fields: {text}, {translation}, {lang} (or [1] in the format of a pair with "-", where the first part is the language of the text field, and the second is {locale} - the language for the translation field; or [2] with a special native field) and optional fields: {id}, {transcription}.

addDictionary.firstLineIsHead: The first line is the column headers
addDictionary.dictionaryName: Choose a name for the Dictionary
addDictionary.dictionaryAdded:
The dictionary "{name}" has been added. 
{link} another dictionary?
addDictionary.countRecords: No records found. | {count} record found. | {count} records found.

error.parse: Could not parse the dictionary format in the {type} file
error.unknown: Invalid file format. Accepted formats: json, csv.
error.collectionExists: A dictionary with this name already exists, please choose another name
error.collectionAdd: The dictionary has failed to be added. Try to reload the page and repeat your steps.

auth.title: Authorization
auth.info:
Authorization would make sense if Yandex.Translate provided access to Favorites for authenticated users. 
But, sadly, this is just a Demo.
